title: Verify that the PRINT button in will call search results is disabled if atleast few of the selected deliveries contain seats that do not require seat assignment

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Launch PV Application
2. Login to the Application using suitable credentials
3. 1.Navigate to Event Administration
2.Create a newe event with inventory type as 'deferred seating'
4. 1.Navigate to Event Access tab for the newly created event
2.Navigate to User tab and select a user 'U1'
3.Set the 'Assign seating' permisison to FALSE for this user
5. 1.Click NEW option to create another event
2.Enter values for all fields
3.,Select inventory type as 'defered seating'
4.Click APPLY CHANGES
6. 1.Navigate to Event Access tab for the newly created event
2.Navigate to User tab and select a user 'U1'
3.Set the 'Assign seating' permisison to TRUE for this user
7. 1.Click NEW option to create another event
2.Enter values for all fields
3.,Select inventory type as 'Inventoried'
4.Click APPLY CHANGES
8. 1.Click NEW option to create another event
2.Enter values for all fields
3.,Select inventory type as 'Non Inventoried'
4.Click APPLY CHANGES
9. 1.Logout from Application
2.Login back to the Application as the user U1 mentioned above
10. 1.Navigate to Ticket sales
2.Select a parton, say P1
3.Select the deferred seating event EVT1 mentioned above
4.Enter seat request 
5.Click LOCK SEATS and get navigated to cart
6.Select delivery method as 'will call'
7.Make payment and complete transaction
11. 1.Navigate to Ticket sales
2.Select the same parton, P1
3.Select the deferred seating event EVT2 mentioned above
4.Enter seat request 
5.Click LOCK SEATS and get navigated to cart
6.Select delivery method as 'will call'
7.Make payment and complete transaction
12. 1.Navigate to Ticket sales
2.Select the same parton, P1
3.Select the inventoried event EVT3 mentioned above
4.Enter seat request 
5.Click LOCK SEATS and get navigated to cart
6.Select delivery method as 'will call'
7.Make payment and complete transaction
13. 1.Navigate to Ticket sales
2.Select the same parton, P1
3.Select the non inventoried event EVT4 mentioned above
4.Enter seat request 
5.Click LOCK SEATS and get navigated to cart
6.Select delivery method as 'will call'
7.Make payment and complete transaction
14. 1.Navigate to Ticket sales
2.Select the same parton, P1
3.Select the deferred seating event EVT1 mentioned above
4.Enter seat request 
5.Click LOCK SEATS and get navigated to cart with unassigned seats offer
6.Click ADD OFFER
6.Select the deferred seating event EVT2
7.Enter seat request
8.Click LOCK SEATS and get navigated to cart with another offer of assigned seats
9.Select delivery method as 'will call'
10.Make payment and complete transaction
15. 1.Click the ADVANCED SEARCH option in the will call portlet in Ticket sales page
2.In the will call search window, enter the patron P1 as search criteria 
3.Click FIND
16. 1.Select all the deliveries
2.Verify the PRINT button
17. Repeat steps 15 to 16 in will call services portal
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. PV Application should be launched sucessfully
2. Login should be successful
3. Deferred seating event shuld be created successfully. Let this event be EVT1
4. Assign seating' permission should be set to FALSE for this event for the user U1
5. Deferred seating event shuld be created successfully. Let this event be EVT2
6. Assign seating' permission should be set to TRUE for this event for the user U1
7. Inventoried event should get created successfully. Let this event be EVT3
8. Non Inventoried event should get created successfully. Let this event be EVT4
9. Login should be successful
10. Sale transaction with unassigned seats should get completed succcesfully with will call as delivery method for the patron P1
11. Sale transaction with assigned seats should get completed succcesfully with will call as delivery method for the patron P1
12. Sale transaction with seats of inventoried event should get completed succcesfully with will call as delivery method for the patron P1
13. Sale transaction with seats of non inventied event should get completed succcesfully with will call as delivery method for the patron P1
14. Sale transaction with unassigned seats and assigned seats should get completed succcesfully with will call as delivery method for the patron P1
15. The will call search results should include all the 5 deliveries created above:

1.Delivery with unassigned seats of deferred seating event EVT1
2.Delivery with assigned seats of deferreed seating event EVT2
3.Delivery with seats of inventoried event EVT3
4.Delivery with seats of non inventoried event EVT4
5.Delivery with unassigned seats of EVT1 and assigned seats of EVT2
16. The 'PRINT" option should be disabled as there are 2 deliveries that require seat assignment
17. The behavior should be same as noted above

3.,Select inventory type as 'Inventoried'
4.Click APPLY CHANGES

2.Login back to the Application as the user U1 mentioned above

2.Select a parton, say P1

6.Select the deferred seating event EVT2
7.Enter seat request
8.Click LOCK SEATS and get navigated to cart with another offer of assigned seats
9.Select delivery method as 'will call'
10.Make payment and complete transaction

2.In the will call search window, enter the patron P1 as search criteria 
3.Click FIND
11. 1.Select only the deliveries that DOES NOT require any seat assignment
2.Verify the PRINT button
12. 1.Click NEW option to create another event
2.Enter values for all fields
3.,Select inventory type as 'defered seating'
4.Click APPLY CHANGES
13. 1.Navigate to Event Access tab for the newly created event
2.Navigate to User tab and select a user 'U1'
3.Set the 'Assign seating' permisison to TRUE for this user
14. 1.Click NEW option to create another event
2.Enter values for all fields
3.,Select inventory type as 'Non Inventoried'
4.Click APPLY CHANGES
15. 1.Navigate to Ticket sales
2.Select the same parton, P1
3.Select the inventoried event EVT3 mentioned above
4.Enter seat request 
5.Click LOCK SEATS and get navigated to cart
6.Select delivery method as 'will call'
7.Make payment and complete transaction
16. 1.Navigate to Ticket sales
2.Select the same parton, P1
3.Select the non inventoried event EVT4 mentioned above
4.Enter seat request 
5.Click LOCK SEATS and get navigated to cart
6.Select delivery method as 'will call'
7.Make payment and complete transaction
17. Click PRINT option
18. Repeat steps 15 to 17 in will call services portal
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. PV Application should be launched sucessfully
2. Login should be successful
3. Deferred seating event shuld be created successfully. Let this event be EVT1
4. Assign seating' permission should be set to FALSE for this event for the user U1
5. Inventoried event should get created successfully. Let this event be EVT3
6. Login should be successful
7. Sale transaction with unassigned seats should get completed succcesfully with will call as delivery method for the patron P1
8. Sale transaction with assigned seats should get completed succcesfully with will call as delivery method for the patron P1
9. Sale transaction with unassigned seats and assigned seats should get completed succcesfully with will call as delivery method for the patron P1
10. The will call search results should include all the 5 deliveries created above:

1.Delivery with unassigned seats of deferred seating event EVT1
2.Delivery with assigned seats of deferreed seating event EVT2
3.Delivery with seats of inventoried event EVT3
4.Delivery with seats of non inventoried event EVT4
5.Delivery with unassigned seats of EVT1 and assigned seats of EVT2
11. PRINT button should be enabled as the selected deliveries does not require any seat assignment
12. Deferred seating event shuld be created successfully. Let this event be EVT2
13. Assign seating' permission should be set to TRUE for this event for the user U1
14. Non Inventoried event should get created successfully. Let this event be EVT4
15. Sale transaction with seats of inventoried event should get completed succcesfully with will call as delivery method for the patron P1
16. Sale transaction with seats of non inventied event should get completed succcesfully with will call as delivery method for the patron P1
17. Print action shuld get invoked and the tickets should get printed successfully
18. The behavior should be same as noted above

title: Verify whether _needs assignment icon_ is NOT displayed in the will call search results for deliveries containing only non inventoried seats

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Launch PV Application
2. Login to the Application using suitable credentials
3. 1.Navigate to Event Administration
2.Create a new event with inventory type as 'Non inventoried'
4. 1.Logout from Application
2.Login back to the Application as the user U1 mentioned above
5. 1.Navigate to Ticket sales
2.Select a parton, say P1
3.Select the non inventoried seating event EVT1 mentioned above
4.Enter seat request 
5.Click LOCK SEATS and get navigated to cart 
6.Select delivery method as 'will call'
7.Make payment and complete transaction
6. 1.Click the ADVANCED SEARCH option in the will call portlet in Ticket sales page
2.In the will call search window, enter the patron P1 as search criteria 
3.Click FIND
7. Verify whether the 'need assignment' icon is displayed against this delivery
8. Repeat steps 6 to 7 in will cal portal
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. PV Application should be launched sucessfully
2. Login should be successful
3. A Non Inventoried event shuld be created successfully. Let this event be EVT1
4. Login should be successful
5. Sale transaction should be completed successfully for this non inventoried event with will call as delivery method for the patron P1.
6. The will call search results should include the delivery record created above
7. As the delivery includes only seats of an inventoried event, the 'need assignment' icon SHOULD NOT be displayed against this delivery
8. The behavior should be same as noted above

title: Verify the V2 Will Call Print Tickets API response using  application property will.call.api.max.limit set

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. 1) Create 1 event and note down the details including Event ID
2) Create Primary and Secondory Event event and note down the details including Event ID
3)Set the value of the application property will.call.api.max.limit set to a value,say,100
2. Launch the Tool - REST client
3. i)Select the HTTP method as POST by clicking on the POST radio button
 ii)Enter the response body parameters and set the response content type
 iii)Set the authentication parameters: Username and password, Auth type select as BASIC and Check Preemptive checkbox
 iv)Select SSl tab and set the hostname verifier to Allow All
 v)Set the Header values
4. i)Enter the URL for V2 Will Call Print Tickets API request on giving query "limit"

ii)Enter other mandatory fields in the request body
iii)Click Green Arrow Button and Verify the Response of V2 Will Call Print Tickets API Request
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. 
2. Tool should be successfully launched
3. Settings should be successfully completed
4. Tickets should be printed and displayed in the response with fields count and moreResults

Conditions:

1)If no limit is used in the URL, maximum of 100 tickets should be printed in the response since 100 is set in the application property
2)If limit is used in the URL and value of limit is less than 100, then number of tickets printed should be based on limit value
3)If limit is used in the URL and value of limit is greater than 100, then number of tickets printed should be based on limit value
4)If limit is used in the URL and value of limit is greater than system value(say 1000), then maximum number of tickets printed should be 1000.

Sub conditions:
[If tickets counts are more than the value provided in the limit paramter, tickets should be printed in the response and display count as same as limit and moreResult should be shown as true
If printed tickets counts are less than the value provided in the limit paramter, tickets should be printed in the response and display count and moreResult should be shown as false
If printed tickets counts are equal to the value provided in the limit paramter, tickets should be printed in the response and display count as same as limt and moreResult should be shown as false]

"The limit value is used for how many deliveries can be queried OR printed"

title: Verify whether tickets purchased in secondary market-my tickets are included in the response of an information request_Driving license

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Prerequisite:

1)Launch PV My Tickets Application
2)Login as seller patron and out few tickets of any event for Resale
3)Logout and Login as Buyer patron
4)Purchase the ticktets put for Resale using Will Call as delivery method

2) Note the agency of user corresponding to My Tickets Replay, event date range,extDevice(scan device id)
2. Get the Driving license  ID number 

Steps to follow

1.Run the Query and obtain the hashed number

select distinct 
        d.HASHED_WILL_CALL_CARD_NMBR as "Hashed Will Call Card Number"
from 
        patron_order po
        inner join 
        order_line_item oli     on 
                po.order_id = oli.order_id
        inner join 
        delivery d on oli.transaction_id = d.transaction_id
where 
        oli.order_id = 

Then encode the hashed number in the following site:

.
3. Launch the Tool for Will call API
4. Select the HTTP method as GET by clicking on  the GET radio button
5. Set the authentication parameters: Username and  password, Auth type select as BASIC and Check  Preemptive checkbox
6. Select SSl tab and set the hostname verfier to 'Allow All'
7. Setup the URL for the information Request in the following  format:

https://irutapppvn54.back.tickets.com:18443/provenue-api/willcall/v1/info/deliveries?max=50&range=c&agency=AGENCYname&extDevice=validID&idNumber=IDnumber

Enter desired value for 'max'
Range can be selected as 'c' or 'a' or 't' as per the event date
Agency should be the corresponding agency for which transcation was completed in My Tickets Application
idNumber should be the encoded hashed number obtained
extDevice should be valid external device ID noted in pre Requisite
8. i)Enter the URL for Informational request (with valid extDevice and valid values for other parameters also) mentioned in previous step
ii)Click Green Arrow Button
9. Verify the Response displayed.
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. Tickets put for resale should be purchased from My Tickets Application using will call as delivery method

Agency of user corresponding to My Tickets Replay, event date range and scan device to be used should be noted down
2. Credit card ID number should be obtained
3. Tool should be launched successfully
4. Radio button should be selected for GET
5. Authentication parameters should be selected  successfully
6. SSL tab setting should be set successfully
7. URL for the information Request should be set up successfully
8. Response should be valid and correct  informations should be provided without any errors
9. Following details should be included in the Response

Ãº Number of tickets in the request
Ãº Delivery ID
Ãº Delivery Name
Ãº Order ID
Ãº Transaction ID
Ãº Event ID
Ãº Event Code
Ãº Event Description
Ãº Attending Patron Account ID
Ãº Patron Contact First Name
Ãº  Patron Contact Last Name
Ãº Ticket ID
Ãº Section Code
Ãº Section Description
Ãº  Row
Ãº  Seat
Ãº  Buyer Type
Ãº  Price Scale Code
Ãº  Price Scale Description
Ãº  Price

Barcode and Print Stream should not be included

Steps to follow

1.Run the Query and obtain the hashed number

select distinct 
        d.HASHED_WILL_CALL_CARD_NMBR as "Hashed Will Call Card Number"
from 
        patron_order po
        inner join 
        order_line_item oli     on 
                po.order_id = oli.order_id
        inner join 
        delivery d on oli.transaction_id = d.transaction_id
where 
        oli.order_id = 

Then encode the hashed number in the following site:

.
3. Launch the Tool for Will call API
4. Select the HTTP method as GET by clicking on  the GET radio button
5. Set the authentication parameters: Username and  password, Auth type select as BASIC and Check  Preemptive checkbox
6. Select SSl tab and set the hostname verfier to 'Allow All'
7. Setup the URL for the information Request in the following  format:

https://irutapppvn54.back.tickets.com:18443/provenue-api/willcall/v1/info/deliveries?max=50&range=c&agency=AGENCYname&extDevice=validID&idNumber=IDnumber

Enter desired value for 'max'
Range can be selected as 'c' or 'a' or 't' as per the event date

idNumber should be the encoded hashed number obtained

Ãº Number of tickets in the request

Ãº Event ID

Ãº  Patron Contact Last Name
Ãº Ticket ID
Ãº Section Code
Ãº Section Description
Ãº  Row
Ãº  Seat
Ãº  Buyer Type
Ãº  Price Scale Code
Ãº  Price Scale Description
Ãº  Price

Barcode and Print Stream should not be included

Details of the returned seats should be noted down.

Steps to follow

1.Run the Query and obtain the hashed number

select distinct 
        d.HASHED_WILL_CALL_CARD_NMBR as "Hashed Will Call Card Number"
from 
        patron_order po
        inner join 
        order_line_item oli     on 
                po.order_id = oli.order_id
        inner join 
        delivery d on oli.transaction_id = d.transaction_id
where 
        oli.order_id = 

Then encode the hashed number in the following site:

.

https://irutapppvn54.back.tickets.com:18443/provenue-api/willcall/v1/info/deliveries?max=50&range=c&agency=AGENCYname&extDevice=validID&idNumber=IDnumber

1)Create events :
a) create an event with todays date and start date 
b) create an event with Active access control monitoring (access control start and end time encompasses current date/time)
c)create events with future date
d)create events with previous dates and time
d)create events with inactive access control. And complete sale transaction for the patron with credit card and in will call delivery method
2) Note the agency of user, event date range,  credit card number(id number), extDevice(scan  device id)
2. Launch the Tool for Will call API
3. Select the HTTP method as GET by clicking on  the GET radio button
4. Set the authentication parameters: Username and  password, Auth type select as BASIC and Check  Preemptive checkbox
5. Select SSl tab and set the hostname verfier to  Allow All
6. i)Enter the URL for Informational request:in  informational request valid values for agency,  range, id number , extDevice , max should be  given. max number should be given valid
ii)Click Green Arrow Button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. 
2. Tool should be launched successfully
3. Radio button should be selected for GET
4. Authentication parameters should be selected  successfully
5. SSL tab setting should be set successfully
6. i)An HTTP status code with 200(OK) should be  displayed along with XML message in response
ii) Response should be valid and correct  informations should be provided without any errors
